content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
using Markdown

function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    # Parse the markdown string into a document tree
    doc = parse_markdown(md)
    
    # Extract all blocks with the "Question" and "Answer" tags
    questions = filter(block -> block.tag == "Question", doc.blocks)
    answers = filter(block -> block.tag == "Answer", doc.blocks)
    
    # Strip leading spaces and newlines from the question and answer text
    question = strip_leading_whitespace(questions[1].text)
    answer = strip_leading_whitespace(answers[1].text)
    
    return (question, answer)
end

function strip_leading_whitespace(text::AbstractString)
    return replace(text, r"^ +", "")
end
```
